The chatbot era ended this week. Not metaphorically. The entire AI industry pivoted to agents simultaneously. Here is the evidence ->

TWEET 2
Anthropic's Model Context Protocol is now adopted by OpenAI, Microsoft, and Google via the Linux Foundation. One shared protocol for agent-tool communication. That is the interoperability inflection point.

---

TWEET 3
Infosys built a dedicated Anthropic Centre of Excellence for AI agents in telecom, finance, and manufacturing. Not a pilot. A center of excellence. That is the enterprise signal.

---

TWEET 4
Alibaba shipped Qwen3.5. ByteDance shipped Doubao 2.0. Both explicitly positioned for the agent era. China is not waiting for consensus. They are building.

---

TWEET 5
Cursor's Composer 1.5 scaled reinforcement learning 20x for agentic coding. The tooling layer is maturing as fast as the models. Orchestrators and executors are the new design language.

## Fact-check notes
- Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP) has been adopted by OpenAI, Microsoft, and Google after being contributed to the Linux Foundation (Source: VT Netzwelt, February 2026)
- Infosys and Anthropic formed a strategic collaboration to build and deploy AI agents in telecom, financial services, manufacturing, and software development, starting with a dedicated Anthropic Centre of Excellence (Source: Enterprise Times, week of 02/16/2026)
- Alibaba released Qwen3.5 and ByteDance released Doubao 2.0, both explicitly positioned for the AI agent era; ByteDance's Doubao chatbot approaches 200 million users in China (Source: Reuters, 02/16/2026)
- Cursor introduced Composer 1.5, scaling reinforcement learning 20x beyond Composer 1 with agentic coding capabilities (Source: NLPlanet/Medium, 02/16/2026)
